stress.中释: 强调；使紧张；加压力于；用重音读
stress.英释: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

create.英释: to make something exist that did not exist before

search.英释: an attempt to find someone or something

report.英释: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

method.中释: 使用体验派表演方法的

future.英释: likely to happen or exist at a time after the present

gamble.英释: an action or plan that involves a risk but that you hope will succeed

critic.中释: 批评家，评论家；爱挑剔的人
critic.英释: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

review.英释: to examine, consider, and judge a situation or process carefully in order to see if changes are necessary

remain.英释: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

nation.英释: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

remove.英释: a distance or amount by which two things are separated

series.中释: 系列，连续；[电] 串联；级数；丛书
series.英释: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

record.英释: You use record to say that something is higher, lower, better, or worse than has ever been achieved before

access.英释: the right to enter a place, use something, see someone etc

effort.英释: an attempt to do something, especially when this involves a lot of hard work or determination

reduce.中释: 减少；降低；使处于；把…分解
reduce.英释: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

action.中释: 行动；活动；功能；战斗；情节
action.英释: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

depend.中释: 依赖，依靠；取决于；相信，信赖
depend.英释: If you depend on someone or something, you need them in order to be able to survive physically, financially, or emotionally

career.英释: to move forwards quickly without control, making sudden sideways movements

belief.英释: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

agency.中释: 代理，中介；代理处，经销处
agency.英释: a business that provides a particular service for people or organizations

formal.中释: 正式的社交活动；夜礼服
formal.英释: a dance at which you have to wear formal clothes

lawyer.英释: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

soccer.英释: a sport played by two teams of 11 players, who try to kick a round ball into their opponents’  goal

source.英释: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

matter.英释: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

growth.英释: an increase in amount, number, or size

senior.中释: 上司；较年长者；毕业班学生
senior.英释: a student in their last year of  high school  or university

return.英释: used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

emerge.英释: to appear or come out from somewhere

ignore.英释: to deliberately pay no attention to something that you have been told or that you know about

native.英释: someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

threat.英释: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

simply.中释: 简单地；仅仅；简直；朴素地；坦白地
simply.英释: used to emphasize what you are saying

expose.英释: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

poetry.英释: poems in general, or the art of writing them

reader.英释: someone who reads books, or who reads in a particular way

policy.英释: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

church.中释: 领…到教堂接受宗教仪式

expect.英释: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

global.英释: affecting or including the whole world

figure.英释: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

aspect.英释: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

memory.中释: 记忆，记忆力；内存，[计] 存储器；回忆
memory.英释: someone’s ability to remember things, places, experiences etc

secure.英释: to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost

origin.英释: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

female.英释: an animal that belongs to the sex that can have babies or produce eggs

charge.中释: 使充电；使承担；指责；装载；对…索费；向…冲去
charge.英释: to say publicly that you think someone has done something wrong

desire.英释: If you desire something, you want it

reject.英释: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

escape.中释: 逃跑；逃亡；逃走；逃跑工具或方法；野生种；泄漏
escape.英释: the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

recent.英释: having happened or started only a short time ago

status.中释: 地位；状态；情形；重要身份
status.英释: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

regard.中释: 注重，考虑；看待；尊敬；把…看作；与…有关
regard.英释: to think about someone or something in a particular way

appeal.中释: 呼吁，请求；吸引力，感染力；上诉；诉诸裁判
appeal.英释: an urgent request for something important

adjust.英释: to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

design.英释: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

commit.中释: 犯罪，做错事；把交托给；指派…作战；使…承担义务
commit.英释: to do something wrong or illegal

hijack.英释: when a plane, vehicle etc is hijacked

manner.中释: 方式；习惯；种类；规矩；风俗
manner.英释: the way in which something is done or happens

repeat.英释: the sign that tells a performer to play a piece of music again, or the music that is played again

manage.英释: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

puzzle.英释: something that is difficult to understand or explain

artist.中释: 艺术家；美术家（尤指画家）；大师
artist.英释: someone who produces art, especially paintings or drawings

crisis.中释: 危机的；用于处理危机的

strain.英释: to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

engage.中释: 吸引，占用；使参加；雇佣；使订婚；预定
engage.英释: to be doing or to become involved in an activity

damage.英释: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body

misery.中释: 痛苦，悲惨；不幸；苦恼；穷困
misery.英释: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

option.中释: [计] 选项；选择权；买卖的特权
option.英释: a choice you can make in a particular situation

energy.英释: power that is used to provide heat, operate machines etc

decide.英释: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

editor.中释: 编者，编辑；社论撰写人；编辑装置
editor.英释: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it

oppose.英释: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

reward.英释: to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked for it

pursue.英释: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

plenty.英释: used to emphasize that something is more than big enough, fast enough etc

gather.英释: a small fold produced by pulling cloth together

refuse.英释: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do

modify.英释: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

insist.英释: to demand that something should happen

object.英释: to state a fact or opinion as a reason for opposing or disapproving of something

active.英释: the active form of a verb, for example ‘destroyed’ in the sentence ‘Enemy planes destroyed the village.’

narrow.英释: to make something narrower or to become narrower

behalf.英释: instead of someone, or as their representative

talent.英释: a natural ability to do something well

subtle.中释: 微妙的；精细的；敏感的；狡猾的；稀薄的
subtle.英释: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

notice.英释: if someone can’t help noticing something, they realize that it exists or is happening even though they are not deliberately trying to pay attention to it

safety.中释: 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打
safety.英释: when someone or something is safe from danger or harm

enable.中释: 使能够，使成为可能；授予权利或方法
enable.英释: to make it possible for someone to do something, or for something to happen

affair.中释: 事情；事务；私事；（尤指关系不长久的）风流韵事
affair.英释: public or political events and activities

ticket.中释: 加标签于；指派；对…开出交通违规罚单
ticket.英释: to give someone a ticket for parking their car in the wrong place, driving too fast etc

phrase.中释: 措词, 将(乐曲)分成乐句

expand.英释: if a company, business etc expands, or if someone expands it, they open new shops, factories etc

budget.英释: very low in price – often used in advertisements

branch.英释: a part of a tree that grows out from the  trunk (=  main stem  )  and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

evolve.中释: 发展，进化；进化；使逐步形成；推断出
evolve.英释: if an animal or plant evolves, it changes gradually over a long period of time

assess.英释: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

salary.英释: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

planet.英释: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.

highly.中释: 高度地；非常；非常赞许地

arouse.英释: to make you become interested, expect something etc

thesis.英释: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

detect.英释: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

unlike.英释: completely different from a particular person or thing

target.中释: 把……作为目标；规定……的指标；瞄准某物
target.英释: to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

length.中释: 长度，长；时间的长短；（语）音长
length.英释: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

pretty.中释: 有吸引力的事物（尤指饰品）；漂亮的人

annual.英释: a plant that lives for one year or season

regret.英释: to feel sorry about something you have done and wish you had not done it

switch.英释: a piece of equipment that starts or stops the flow of electricity to a machine, light etc when you push it

agenda.中释: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
agenda.英释: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

secret.英释: known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others

strike.英释: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

famous.中释: 著名的；极好的，非常令人满意的
famous.英释: known about by many people in many places

casual.中释: 便装；临时工人；待命士兵

settle.英释: a seat, for two or more people, usually made of wood with a high back and arms, and sometimes having a storage space in the boxlike seat

modest.中释: (Modest)人名；(罗)莫代斯特；(德)莫德斯特；(俄)莫杰斯特

invite.英释: an invitation to a party, meal etc

extend.中释: 延伸；扩大；推广；伸出；给予；使竭尽全力；对…估价
extend.英释: to continue for a particular distance or over a particular area

absorb.中释: 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注
absorb.英释: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

speech.中释: 演讲；讲话；[语] 语音；演说
speech.英释: a talk, especially a formal one about a particular subject, given to a group of people

oblige.中释: 迫使；强制；赐，施恩惠；责成；义务
oblige.英释: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

colony.中释: 殖民地；移民队；种群；动物栖息地
colony.英释: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

divide.英释: a line of high ground between two river systems

cancer.英释: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

admire.英释: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

belong.中释: 属于，应归入；居住；适宜；应被放置
belong.英释: If something belongs to you, you own it

inform.英释: to officially tell someone about something or give them information

assume.英释: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

ensure.英释: to make certain that something will happen properly

holder.中释: 持有人；所有人；固定器；（台、架等）支持物
holder.英释: someone who owns or controls something

couple.英释: to join or fasten two things together

relief.中释: 救济；减轻，解除；安慰；浮雕
relief.英释: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

recall.英释: an official order telling someone to return to a place, especially before they expected to

monday.英释: Monday is the day after Sunday and before Tuesday

abound.英释: If things abound, or if a place abounds with things, there are very large numbers of them

verbal.英释: a word that has been formed from a verb, for example a gerund, infinitive, or participle

occupy.英释: to live or stay in a place

severe.中释: 严峻的；严厉的；剧烈的；苛刻的
severe.英释: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

custom.英释: custom products or services are specially designed and made for a particular person

marine.中释: 海运业；舰队；水兵；（海军）士兵或军官
marine.英释: A marine is a member of an armed force, for example the U.S. Marine Corps or the Royal Marines, who is specially trained for military duties at sea as well as on land.

locate.英释: to find the exact position of something

wisdom.中释: 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言
wisdom.英释: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

detach.英释: If you detach one thing from another that it is attached to, you remove it. If one thing detaches from another, it becomes separated from it.

splash.英释: a mark made by a liquid splashing onto something else

bypass.英释: a road that goes around a town or other busy area rather than through it

breath.中释: 呼吸，气息；一口气，（呼吸的）一次；瞬间，瞬息；微风；迹象；无声音，气音
breath.英释: to start breathing normally again after running or making a lot of effort

bother.英释: trouble or difficulty that has been caused by small problems and that usually only continues for a short time

submit.英释: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

attach.中释: 使依附；贴上；系上；使依恋
attach.英释: If you attach something to an object, you join it or fasten it to the object

castle.中释: 置…于城堡中；筑城堡防御

behave.中释: 表现；（机器等）运转；举止端正；（事物）起某种作用
behave.英释: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc

revive.中释: 复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神
revive.英释: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

strict.中释: 严格的；绝对的；精确的；详细的
strict.英释: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

danger.英释: the possibility that someone or something will be harmed, destroyed, or killed

resent.英释: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

gender.中释: 生（过去式gendered，过去分词gendered，现在分词gendering，第三人称单数genders，形容词genderless）

victim.英释: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

resume.中释: 重新开始，继续；恢复，重新占用
resume.英释: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

prefer.英释: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

vessel.中释: 船，舰；[组织] 脉管，血管；容器，器皿

format.英释: to organize the space on a computer  disk  so that information can be stored on it

debate.英释: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions

attend.中释: 出席；上（大学等）；照料；招待；陪伴
attend.英释: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

repair.英释: something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

advice.英释: an opinion you give someone about what they should do

assert.中释: 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称
assert.英释: to state firmly that something is true

window.英释: a space or an area of glass in the wall of a building or vehicle that lets in light

ritual.中释: 仪式的；例行的；礼节性的
ritual.英释: done in a fixed and expected way, but without real meaning or sincerity

invest.中释: 投资；覆盖；耗费；授予；包围
invest.英释: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

vacuum.英释: to clean using a vacuum cleaner

engine.中释: 引擎，发动机；机车，火车头；工具
engine.英释: the part of a vehicle that produces power to make it move

barely.中释: 仅仅，勉强；几乎不；公开地；贫乏地
barely.英释: only with great difficulty or effort

normal.英释: the usual state, level, or amount

thrive.英释: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

temper.中释: 使回火；锻炼；调和；使缓和
temper.英释: to make something less severe or extreme

string.英释: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

praise.英释: to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

excuse.英释: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless

oxygen.英释: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

forest.英释: a large area of land that is covered with trees

supply.英释: to provide people with something that they need or want, especially regularly over a long period of time

palace.英释: the official home of a person of very high rank, especially a king or queen – often used in names

unfold.英释: if a story unfolds, or if someone unfolds it, it is told

partly.英释: to some degree, but not completely

client.英释: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

feeble.中释: 微弱的，无力的；虚弱的；薄弱的

aspire.英释: to desire and work towards achieving something important

sunday.英释: Sunday is the day after Saturday and before Monday

comply.英释: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

stable.英释: to put or keep a horse in a stable

lounge.中释: 闲逛；懒洋洋地躺卧；闲混
lounge.英释: to stand, sit, or lie in a lazy or relaxed way

credit.中释: 相信，信任；把…归给，归功于；赞颂
credit.英释: to believe or admit that someone has a quality, or has done something good

muscle.中释: 加强；使劲搬动；使劲挤出
muscle.英释: to use your strength to go somewhere

mature.英释: to become fully grown or developed

steady.中释: 关系固定的情侣；固定支架
steady.英释: a  boyfriend  or  girlfriend  that someone has been having a romantic relationship with

infant.中释: 婴儿的；幼稚的；初期的；未成年的
infant.英释: intended for babies or very young children

column.中释: 纵队，列；专栏；圆柱，柱形物
column.英释: a tall solid upright stone post used to support a building or as a decoration

deduce.英释: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

embark.英释: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

clinic.英释: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

visual.中释: 视觉的，视力的；栩栩如生的

stream.英释: to flow quickly and in great amounts

remind.英释: to make someone remember something that they must do

rocket.英释: a vehicle used for travelling or carrying things into space, which is shaped like a big tube

esteem.英释: a feeling of respect for someone, or a good opinion of someone

worthy.英释: someone who is important and should be respected

accuse.英释: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

manual.英释: a book that gives instructions about how to do something, especially how to use a machine

pencil.英释: to write something or make a mark with a pencil

aboard.英释: on or onto a ship, plane, or train

dinner.英释: the main meal of the day, eaten in the middle of the day or the evening

shadow.英释: the group of politicians in the British parliament who would become ministers if their party was in government

laptop.中释: 膝上型轻便电脑，笔记本电脑
laptop.英释: a small computer that you can carry with you

delete.英释: to remove something that has been written down or stored in a computer

wallet.英释: a small flat case, often made of leather, that you carry in your pocket, for holding paper money, bank cards etc

sample.中释: 试样的，样品的；作为例子的

glance.中释: 扫视，匆匆一看；反光；瞥闪，瞥见
glance.英释: to quickly look at someone or something

endure.英释: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

urgent.英释: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

luxury.英释: A luxury item is something expensive which is not necessary but which gives you pleasure

tissue.中释: 饰以薄纱；用化妆纸揩去

screen.英释: to do tests on a lot of people to find out whether they have a particular illness

tailor.英释: someone whose job is to make men’s clothes, that are measured to fit each customer perfectly

guilty.英释: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

cherry.中释: 樱桃；樱桃树；如樱桃的鲜红色；处女膜，处女
cherry.英释: a small round red or black fruit with a long thin stem and a stone in the middle

parade.英释: to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

pocket.中释: 小型的，袖珍的；金钱上的
pocket.英释: You use pocket to describe something that is small enough to fit into a pocket, often something that is a smaller version of a larger item

pledge.中释: 保证，许诺；用……抵押；举杯祝……健康
pledge.英释: to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

census.英释: an official process of counting a country’s population and finding out about the people

depict.英释: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

defend.英释: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

assign.中释: 分配；指派；[计][数] 赋值
assign.英释: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

genius.英释: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

studio.中释: 工作室；[广播][电视] 演播室；画室；电影制片厂
studio.英释: a film company or the buildings it owns and uses to make its films

rescue.英释: when someone or something is rescued from danger

insect.英释: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

impair.英释: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

mutual.英释: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

ending.英释: the way that a story, film, activity etc finishes

timber.英释: wood used for building or making things

foster.中释: (Foster)人名；(英、捷、意、葡、法、德、俄、西)福斯特

advise.中释: 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告
advise.英释: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

remark.英释: to say something, especially about something you have just noticed

permit.英释: an official written statement giving you the right to do something

fellow.中释: 使…与另一个对等；使…与另一个匹敌

abrupt.中释: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的

humble.中释: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
humble.英释: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

summon.英释: to order someone to come to a place

gossip.英释: If you gossip with someone, you talk informally, especially about other people or local events. You can also say that two people gossip.

heroin.英释: a powerful and illegal drug made from  morphine

clause.英释: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document

plough.英释: a piece of farm equipment used to turn over the earth so that seeds can be planted

outlet.中释: 出口，排放孔；[电] 电源插座；销路；发泄的方法；批发商店
outlet.英释: a way of expressing or getting rid of strong feelings

resort.中释: 求助，诉诸；常去；采取某手段或方法
resort.英释: If you resort to a course of action that you do not really approve of, you adopt it because you cannot see any other way of achieving what you want

allege.中释: 宣称，断言；提出…作为理由
allege.英释: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

regime.中释: 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制
regime.英释: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

region.英释: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

thrill.中释: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
thrill.英释: to make someone feel excited and happy

scream.中释: 尖叫声；尖锐刺耳的声音；极其滑稽可笑的人
scream.英释: a loud high sound that you make with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

stripe.英释: to mark with a stripe or stripes

induce.英释: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

senate.中释: 参议院，上院；（古罗马的）元老院
senate.英释: the highest level of government in ancient Rome

thrift.中释: 节俭；节约；[植] 海石竹
thrift.英释: wise and careful use of money, so that none is wasted

harden.中释: (Harden)人名；(英、德、罗、瑞典)哈登；(法)阿尔当

ballot.英释: to ask someone to vote for something

strive.英释: to make a great effort to achieve something

ballet.英释: a performance in which dancing and music tell a story without any speaking

slogan.英释: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc

remedy.英释: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better

advent.中释: 到来；出现；基督降临；基督降临节
advent.英释: the time when something first begins to be widely used

shield.英释: to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

dilute.英释: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

coupon.中释: 息票；赠券；联票；[经] 配给券
coupon.英释: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free

museum.英释: a building where important  cultural  , historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public

assure.中释: 保证；担保；使确信；弄清楚
assure.英释: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

affirm.英释: to state publicly that something is true

exotic.中释: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
exotic.英释: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

bruise.英释: to affect someone badly and make them feel less confident

stroll.英释: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way

battle.英释: to try very hard to achieve something that is difficult or dangerous

fabric.中释: 织物；布；组织；构造；建筑物
fabric.英释: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

junior.中释: 年少者，晚辈；地位较低者；大学三年级学生
junior.英释: a child who goes to a junior school

season.英释: to add salt, pepper etc to food you are cooking

adjoin.英释: a room, building, or piece of land that adjoins something is next to it and connected to it

excite.英释: to make someone feel happy, interested, or eager

mammal.英释: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

launch.中释: 发射；发行，投放市场；下水；汽艇
launch.英释: when a new product, book etc is made available or made known

filter.中释: 滤波器；[化工] 过滤器；筛选；滤光器
filter.英释: something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

ribbon.中释: 把…撕成条带；用缎带装饰

scrape.英释: to remove something from a surface using the edge of a knife, a stick etc

forbid.中释: 禁止；不准；不允许；〈正式〉严禁
forbid.英释: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

legend.中释: 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字
legend.英释: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

entity.英释: something that exists as a single and complete unit

barber.英释: a man whose job is to cut men’s hair and sometimes to  shave  them

deduct.英释: to take away an amount or part from a total

wicked.中释: 邪恶的；恶劣的；不道德的；顽皮的
wicked.英释: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

riddle.中释: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
riddle.英释: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

avenue.中释: 大街；林荫大道；[比喻](达到某物的)途径，手段，方法，渠道
avenue.英释: used in the names of streets in a town or city

brandy.英释: a strong alcoholic drink made from wine, or a glass of this drink

retort.英释: to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

polite.中释: 有礼貌的，客气的；文雅的；上流的；优雅的
polite.英释: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings

finger.英释: to touch or handle something with your fingers

futile.中释: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
futile.英释: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

patrol.英释: to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

patron.英释: someone who supports the activities of an organization, for example by giving money

insult.英释: a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

stereo.中释: 立体的；立体声的；立体感觉的
stereo.英释: using a recording or broadcasting system in which the sound is directed through two  speakers

shabby.中释: 破旧的；卑鄙的；吝啬的；低劣的
shabby.英释: shabby clothes, places, or objects are untidy and in bad condition because they have been used for a long time

gallop.中释: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
gallop.英释: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

gallon.英释: a unit for measuring liquids, equal to eight pints. In Britain this is 4.55 litres, and in the US it is 3.79 litres.

insure.英释: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

breach.英释: to break a law, rule, or agreement

plague.英释: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

gloomy.英释: making you feel that things will not improve

outset.英释: at or from the beginning of an event or process

robust.中释: 强健的；健康的；粗野的；粗鲁的
robust.英释: a robust person is strong and healthy

injure.英释: to say unfair or unpleasant things that hurt someone’s pride, feelings etc

horror.中释: 惊骇；惨状；极端厌恶；令人恐怖的事物
horror.英释: a strong feeling of shock and fear

intact.中释: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的

tunnel.中释: 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道
tunnel.英释: to dig a long passage under the ground

decent.中释: 正派的；得体的；相当好的
decent.英释: of a good enough standard or quality

clergy.英释: the official leaders of religious activities in organized religions, such as priests,  rabbi s  , and  mullah s

sunset.英释: the time of day when the sun disappears and night begins

stupid.英释: an insulting way of talking to someone who you think is being stupid

wrench.英释: to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held

script.英释: The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

saddle.英释: to put a saddle on a horse

sprout.英释: a small green vegetable like a very small  cabbage

coarse.英释: having a rough surface that feels slightly hard

plural.英释: a form of a word that shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘dogs’ is the plural of ‘dog’

deceit.英释: behaviour that is intended to make someone believe something that is not true

recipe.中释: 食谱；[临床] 处方；秘诀；烹饪法
recipe.英释: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

collar.中释: 抓住；给…上领子；给…套上颈圈
collar.英释: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape

cradle.中释: 抚育；把搁在支架上；把放在摇篮内

pigeon.英释: a grey bird with short legs that is common in cities

hammer.中释: 铁锤；链球；[解剖] 锤骨；音锤
hammer.英释: the part of a gun that hits the explosive charge that fires a bullet

jacket.中释: 给…穿夹克；给…装护套；给…包上护封；〈口〉打

faulty.英释: not working properly, or not made correctly

escort.英释: to take someone somewhere, especially when you are protecting or guarding them

bridge.英释: to build or form a bridge over something

scheme.英释: If you say that people are scheming, you mean that they are making secret plans in order to gain something for themselves

murmur.中释: 低声说；私下抱怨；发出轻柔持续的声音
murmur.英释: to make a soft low sound

afraid.英释: frightened because you think that you may get hurt or that something bad may happen

shower.英释: to give someone a lot of things

purify.英释: to remove dirty or harmful substances from something

detain.英释: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

recite.英释: to say a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to

vanity.中释: 虚荣心；空虚；浮华；无价值的东西
vanity.英释: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

clutch.中释: 没有手提带或背带的；紧要关头的

accent.英释: to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

ethnic.英释: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

punish.中释: 惩罚；严厉对待；贪婪地吃喝
punish.英释: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

climax.英释: the most exciting or important part of a story or experience, which usually comes near the end

relish.中释: 盼望;期待;享受; 品味；喜爱；给…加佐料
relish.英释: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen

porter.中释: 门房；服务员；行李搬运工；守门人
porter.英释: someone whose job is to carry people’s bags at railway stations, airports etc

heaven.英释: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

caress.英释: a gentle touch or kiss that shows you love someone

murder.英释: the crime of deliberately killing someone

pierce.中释: 刺穿；洞察；响彻；深深地打动
pierce.英释: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

triple.英释: to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

rhythm.英释: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

nephew.英释: the son of your brother or sister, or the son of your husband’s or wife’s brother or sister

cruise.英释: a holiday on a large ship

refute.英释: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

friday.英释: Friday is the day after Thursday and before Saturday

offend.英释: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc

invent.英释: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

tomato.英释: a round soft red fruit eaten raw or cooked as a vegetable

verify.英释: to discover whether something is correct or true

exceed.英释: to be more than a particular number or amount

helmet.英释: a strong hard hat that soldiers,  motorcycle  riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads

grease.英释: a fatty or oily substance that comes off meat when it is cooked, or off food made using butter or oil

digest.英释: a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

arrest.英释: when the police take someone away and guard them because they may have done something illegal

denial.英释: a statement saying that something is not true

inject.英释: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

temple.英释: a building where people go to  worship  , in the Jewish, Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, and Mormon religions

kidnap.英释: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

lumber.中释: 木材；废物，无用的杂物；隆隆声
lumber.英释: pieces of wood used for building, that have been cut to specific lengths and widths

unload.英释: to remove a load from a vehicle, ship etc

absent.英释: to not go to a place or take part in an event where people expect you to be

tumble.英释: a fall, especially from a high place or level

salute.英释: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc

heroic.英释: If you describe someone's actions or plans as heroics, you think that they are foolish or dangerous because they are too difficult or brave for the situation in which they occur

tablet.中释: 用碑牌纪念；将(备忘录等)写在板上；将…制成小片或小块

radius.中释: 半径，半径范围；[解剖] 桡骨；辐射光线；有效航程
radius.英释: the distance from the centre to the edge of a circle, or a line drawn from the centre to the edge

legacy.英释: something that happens or exists as a result of things that happened at an earlier time

artery.英释: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

latent.英释: something that is latent is present but hidden, and may develop or become more noticeable in the future

survey.英释: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions

tongue.英释: to use your tongue to make separate sounds when playing a musical instrument

fridge.英释: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, used for keeping food and drinks cool

kidney.英释: one of the two organs in your lower back that separate waste products from your blood and make urine

solemn.中释: 庄严的，严肃的；隆重的，郑重的
solemn.英释: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

virgin.英释: someone who has never had sex

betray.中释: 背叛；出卖；泄露（秘密）；露出…迹象
betray.英释: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

voyage.英释: to travel to a place, especially by ship

butter.英释: a solid yellow food made from milk or cream that you spread on bread or use in cooking

quartz.英释: a hard mineral substance that is used in making electronic watches and clocks

domain.英释: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

linear.中释: 线的，线型的；直线的，线状的；长度的
linear.英释: consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line

napkin.英释: a square piece of cloth or paper used for protecting your clothes and for cleaning your hands and lips during a meal

quiver.英释: to shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited etc

versus.英释: used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case

priest.中释: 使成为神职人员；任命…为祭司

galaxy.中释: 银河；[天] 星系；银河系；一群显赫的人
galaxy.英释: one of the large groups of stars that make up the universe

garage.中释: 把……送入车库；把（汽车）开进车库
garage.英释: to put or keep a vehicle in a garage

sponge.英释: a piece of a soft natural or artificial substance full of small holes, which can suck up liquid and is used for washing

treaty.英释: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

export.英释: to sell goods to another country

reckon.英释: spoken to think or suppose something

button.英释: to fasten clothes with buttons, or to be fastened with buttons

utmost.英释: You can use utmost to emphasize the importance or seriousness of something or to emphasize the way that it is done

inhale.英释: to breathe in air, smoke, or gas

violin.英释: a small wooden musical instrument that you hold under your chin and play by pulling a bow(= special stick ) across the strings

cousin.中释: 堂兄弟姊妹；表兄弟姊妹
cousin.英释: the child of your  uncle  or  aunt

outfit.英释: to provide someone or something with a set of clothes or equipment, especially ones that are needed for a particular purpose

meadow.英释: a field with wild grass and flowers

banana.中释: 香蕉；喜剧演员；大鹰钩鼻
banana.英释: a long curved tropical fruit with a yellow skin

piston.英释: a part of an engine consisting of a short solid piece of metal inside a tube, which moves up and down to make the other parts of the engine move

expend.英释: to use or spend a lot of energy etc in order to do something

prince.英释: the son of a king, queen, or prince

dealer.英释: someone who buys and sells a particular product, especially an expensive one

brutal.中释: 残忍的；野蛮的，不讲理的

litter.中释: 乱丢；给…垫褥草；把…弄得乱七八糟
litter.英释: if things litter an area, there are a lot of them in that place, scattered in an untidy way

propel.英释: to move, drive, or push something forward

dismay.英释: If you are dismayed by something, it makes you feel afraid, worried, or sad

excess.英释: additional and not needed because there is already enough of something

maiden.英释: a young girl, or a woman who is not married

cheque.英释: a printed piece of paper that you write an amount of money on, sign, and use instead of money to pay for things

typist.英释: a secretary whose main job is to  type  letters

suburb.英释: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

tragic.英释: a tragic event or situation makes you feel very sad, especially because it involves death or suffering

hazard.英释: something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

pickup.中释: 收集，整理；小卡车；拾起；搭车者；偶然结识者

indoor.英释: used or happening inside a building

freeze.英释: a time when people are not allowed to increase prices or pay

circus.英释: a group of people and animals who travel to different places performing skilful tricks as entertainment

circle.英释: to move in the shape of a circle around something, especially in the air

bottle.英释: to put a liquid, especially wine or beer, into a bottle after you have made it

tender.中释: 提供，偿还；使…变嫩；使…变柔软

clothe.英释: to put clothes on your body

bundle.英释: to include computer software or other services with a new computer at no extra cost

liable.中释: 有责任的，有义务的；应受罚的；有…倾向的；易…的
liable.英释: legally responsible for the cost of something

sticky.英释: made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces

orange.英释: a round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside

uproar.英释: a lot of noise or angry protest about something

strife.英释: trouble between two or more people or groups

magnet.中释: 磁铁；[电磁] 磁体；磁石
magnet.英释: a piece of iron or steel that can stick to metal or make other metal objects move towards itself

mortal.英释: a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

stride.中释: 跨过；大踏步走过；跨坐在…
stride.英释: If you stride somewhere, you walk there with quick, long steps

valley.英释: an area of lower land between two lines of hills or mountains, usually with a river flowing through it

tackle.英释: to try to deal with a difficult problem

quench.中释: 熄灭，[机] 淬火；解渴；结束；冷浸
quench.英释: to stop yourself feeling thirsty, by drinking something

turkey.英释: a bird that looks like a large chicken and is often eaten at Christmas and at Thanksgiving

carrot.英释: a long pointed orange vegetable that grows under the ground

refund.英释: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for

vapour.英释: a mass of very small drops of a liquid which float in the air, for example because the liquid has been heated

inland.中释: 在内地；向内地；向内陆；在内陆
inland.英释: in a direction away from the coast and towards the centre of a country

clever.英释: able to learn and understand things quickly

recede.英释: When something such as a quality, problem, or illness recedes, it becomes weaker, smaller, or less intense

tanker.中释: 油轮；运油飞机；油槽车；坦克手
tanker.英释: a vehicle or ship specially built to carry large quantities of gas or liquid, especially oil

poster.英释: a large printed notice, picture, or photograph, used to advertise something or as a decoration

closet.英释: to shut someone in a room away from other people in order to discuss something private, to be alone etc

rotary.中释: 旋转式机器；[动力] 转缸式发动机

kettle.英释: a container with a lid, a handle, and a spout,used for boiling and pouring water

driver.中释: 驾驶员；驱动程序；起子；传动器
driver.英释: someone who drives a car, bus etc

supper.英释: the meal that you have in the early evening

warmth.英释: the heat something produces, or when you feel warm

coffee.英释: a hot dark brown drink that has a slightly bitter taste

shiver.英释: to shake slightly because you are cold or frightened

uneasy.中释: 不舒服的；心神不安的；不稳定的
uneasy.英释: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

satire.中释: 讽刺；讽刺文学，讽刺作品
satire.英释: a way of criticizing something such as a group of people or a system, in which you deliberately make them seem funny so that people will see their faults

locker.中释: 柜，箱；上锁的人；有锁的橱柜；锁扣装置；有锁的存物柜
locker.英释: a small cupboard with a lock in a school, sports building, office etc, where you can leave clothes or possessions while you do something

hunger.英释: If you say that someone hungers for something or hungers after it, you are emphasizing that they want it very much

feudal.中释: 封建制度的；领地的；世仇的

layman.中释: 外行；门外汉；俗人；一般信徒
layman.英释: someone who is not trained in a particular subject or type of work, especially when they are being compared with someone who is

cattle.中释: 牛；牲畜（骂人的话）；家畜；无价值的人
cattle.英释: cows and  bull s  kept on a farm for their meat or milk

stitch.英释: to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

campus.中释: （大学）校园；大学，大学生活；校园内的草地
campus.英释: the land and buildings of a university or college, including the buildings where students live

notify.英释: to formally or officially tell someone about something

savage.英释: if an animal such as a dog savages someone, it attacks them and injures them badly

cinema.中释: 电影；电影院；电影业，电影制作术
cinema.英释: a building in which films are shown

beware.英释: used to warn someone to be careful because something is dangerous

jargon.英释: words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval

bounce.英释: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it

offset.中释: 抵消；弥补；用平版印刷术印刷
offset.英释: if the cost or amount of something offsets another cost or amount, the two things have an opposite effect so that the situation remains the same

dazzle.英释: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time

peanut.英释: a pale brown nut in a thin shell which grows under the ground

hatred.英释: an angry feeling of extreme dislike for someone or something

stroke.中释: （用笔等）画；轻抚；轻挪；敲击；划尾桨；划掉；（打字时）击打键盘
stroke.英释: to move your hand gently over something

pardon.英释: to officially allow someone who has been found guilty of a crime to go free without being punished

empire.英释: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

famine.英释: a situation in which a large number of people have little or no food for a long time and many people die

defect.英释: to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

dragon.中释: 龙；凶暴的人，凶恶的人；严厉而有警觉性的女人
dragon.英释: a large imaginary animal that has wings and a long tail and can breathe out fire

honest.中释: 诚实的，实在的；可靠的；坦率的
honest.英释: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

revolt.英释: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

invade.英释: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

defeat.中释: 失败的事实；击败的行为

yellow.英释: to become yellow or make something become yellow

bureau.英释: a government department or a part of a government department in the US

static.英释: noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

puppet.中释: 木偶；傀儡；受他人操纵的人
puppet.英释: a model of a person or animal that you move by pulling wires or strings, or by putting your hand inside it

cosmic.英释: relating to space or the universe

pirate.英释: to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, video, or computer program

thrust.英释: If you thrust your way somewhere, you move there, pushing between people or things which are in your way

camera.英释: a piece of equipment used to take photographs or make films or television programmes

fluent.中释: 流畅的，流利的；液态的；畅流的
fluent.英释: able to speak a language very well

sacred.中释: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
sacred.英释: relating to a god or religion

potato.中释: [作物] 土豆，[作物] 马铃薯
potato.英释: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or pale yellow skin, that grows under the ground

greedy.英释: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

mirror.英释: if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it

module.英释: one of several separate parts that can be combined to form a larger object, such as a machine or building

storey.英释: a floor or level of a building

drawer.中释: 抽屉；开票人；出票人；起草者；酒馆侍
drawer.英释: part of a piece of furniture, such as a desk, that you pull out and push in and use to keep things in

ignite.英释: to start burning, or to make something start burning

plunge.中释: 突然地下降；投入；陷入；跳进
plunge.英释: to move, fall, or be thrown suddenly forwards or downwards

barrel.英释: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc

mosaic.英释: a pattern or picture made by fitting together small pieces of coloured stone, glass etc

aerial.英释: a piece of equipment for receiving or sending radio or television signals, usually consisting of a piece of metal or wire

thread.英释: to put a thread, string, rope etc through a hole

spider.英释: a small creature with eight legs, which catches insects using a fine network of sticky threads

sneeze.英释: the act or sound of sneezing

cloudy.中释: 多云的；阴天的；愁容满面的
cloudy.英释: a cloudy sky, day etc is dark because there are a lot of clouds

cement.英释: a grey powder made from  lime  and clay that becomes hard when it is mixed with water and allowed to dry, and that is used in building

saucer.中释: 茶托，浅碟；浅碟形物；眼睛
saucer.英释: a small round plate that curves up at the edges, that you put a cup on

zigzag.中释: 曲折地；之字形地；Z字形地
zigzag.英释: to move forward in sharp angles, first to the left and then to the right etc

starve.英释: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat

mobile.英释: a decoration made of small objects tied to wires or string which is hung up so that the objects move when air blows around them

sister.英释: You can use sister to describe something that is of the same type or is connected in some way to another thing you have mentioned. For example, if a company has a sister company, they are connected.

sketch.英释: to draw a sketch of something

enroll.中释: 登记；使加入；把记入名册；使入伍

county.英释: an area of a state or country that has its own government to deal with local matters

insert.中释: 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片
insert.英释: something that is designed to be put inside something else

terror.中释: 恐怖；恐怖行动；恐怖时期；可怕的人

carpet.英释: heavy woven material for covering floors or stairs, or a piece of this material

liquid.英释: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk

virtue.英释: moral goodness of character and behaviour

beauty.中释: 美；美丽；美人；美好的东西
beauty.英释: a quality that people, places, or things have that makes them very attractive to look at

easter.英释: Easter is a Christian festival when Jesus Christ's return to life is celebrated. It is celebrated on a Sunday in March or April.

impart.中释: 给予（尤指抽象事物），传授；告知，透露
impart.英释: to give a particular quality to something

chorus.英释: if people chorus something, they say it at the same time

spiral.中释: 使成螺旋形；使作螺旋形上升
spiral.英释: to move in a continuous curve that gets nearer to or further from its central point as it goes round

grocer.英释: someone who owns or works in a shop that sells food and other things used in the home

clumsy.英释: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

paddle.英释: to move a small light boat through water, using one or more paddles

weight.英释: If you weight something, you make it heavier by adding something to it, for example, in order to stop it from moving easily

serial.中释: 电视连续剧；[图情] 期刊；连载小说
serial.英释: a story that is broadcast or printed in several separate parts on television, in a magazine etc

garlic.英释: a plant like a small onion, used in cooking to give a strong taste

burden.英释: If someone burdens you with something that is likely to worry you, for example, a problem or a difficult decision, they tell you about it

ascend.英释: to move up through the air

refine.英释: to improve a method, plan, system etc by gradually making slight changes to it

expire.英释: if a period of time when someone has a particular position of authority expires, it ends

layoff.中释: 活动停止期间；临时解雇；操作停止；失业期
layoff.英释: When there are layoffs in a company, people become unemployed because there is no more work for them in the company

symbol.英释: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

tumour.英释: a mass of diseased cells in your body that have divided and increased too quickly

petrol.英释: a liquid obtained from  petroleum  that is used to supply power to the engine of cars and other vehicles

obtain.英释: to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

beside.英释: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

reform.英释: a change or changes made to a system or organization in order to improve it

common.英释: a large area of open land in a town or village that people walk or play sport on

member.英释: a person or country that belongs to a group or organization

simple.中释: 简单的；迟钝的,头脑简单的
simple.英释: not difficult or complicated to do or understand

finite.英释: having an end or a limit

doctor.英释: to dishonestly change something in order to gain an advantage

namely.英释: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to

actual.英释: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

device.英释: a machine or tool that does a special job

direct.英释: to be in charge of something or control it

affect.英释: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

follow.英释: to go, walk, drive etc behind or after someone else

former.英释: happening or existing before, but not now

office.中释: 办公室,办事处；职务,公职；部,局,处
office.英释: a building that belongs to a company or organization, with rooms where people can work at desks

prayer.英释: words that you say when praying to God or gods

parent.英释: the father or mother of a person or animal

medium.英释: of middle size, level, or amount

bottom.中释: 底(部),基础,根基；海底,湖底,河床

accept.英释: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

middle.英释: nearest the centre and furthest from the edge, top, end etc

market.英释: to try to persuade people to buy a product by advertising it in a particular way, using attractive packages etc

system.中释: 系统，体系；制度；一套办法
system.英释: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

tactic.英释: the science of arranging and moving military forces in a battle

finish.中释: 完成；结束；（被）吃光，（被）喝光
finish.英释: to complete the last part of something that you are doing

merely.英释: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

result.中释: 结果,致使,导致,由…而造成
result.英释: If something results in a particular situation or event, it causes that situation or event to happen

comedy.英释: entertainment that is intended to make people laugh

profit.英释: to get money from doing something

second.英释: to formally support a suggestion made by another person in a meeting

Monday.英释: the day between Sunday and Tuesday

dialog.英释: a conversation in a book, play, or film

signal.英释: to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something
